learning_outcomes.description: Implement Digital Signal Processing algorithms in MATLAB
Use and apply data windowing appropriately to solve a range of filtering and analysis problems
Code fundamental DSP algorithms such as the FFT and multi-rate filters
Be able to describe the DSP processing chain of DSP-based devices such as a CD player
Acquire an international perspective on the field through the advanced topics delivered by guest lecturers and recognized researchers

assessments.task_description:
This task is designed to assess your understanding of convolution and your ability to apply it effectively across a series of questions. You will be required to demonstrate both theoretical knowledge and practical skills related to convolution operations, including their application in signal processing or image processing, depending on the context of the questions.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This task focuses on the application of filters. You will be expected to design, implement, and analyze basic FIR and/or IIR filters. The task may include frequency response analysis, filter stability, and using tools like MATLAB to apply filters to sample signals. Your understanding of filter characteristics and performance will be evaluated.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This task will assess your understanding of the FFT and its applications in signal analysis and computation. You will explore theoretical derivations, practical signal transformations, and computational techniques using FFT in MATLAB. Emphasis will be placed on interpreting results, comparing methods, and applying the FFT to solve real-world signal processing problems.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
